de.bioforscher.singa.chemistry.physical.branches

Class Chain

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bioforscher.singa.chemistry.physical.branches.BranchSubstructure<Chain,java.lang.String>
      • de.bioforscher.singa.chemistry.physical.branches.Chain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StructuralEntity<Chain,java.lang.String>, Substructure<Chain,java.lang.String>, Graph<Atom,Bond,java.lang.Integer>, Node<Chain,Vector3D,java.lang.String>

    public class Chain
extends BranchSubstructure<Chain,java.lang.String>
    The chainIdentifier is one of the grouping elements that should contain primarily residues and are connected to form a single molecule. This model is adopted from the classical PDB structure files. Since this also implements the nameable interface, the name of a chin is its chainIdentifier pdbIdentifier (a single letter).
    See Also:
    AminoAcid

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chain

        public Chain(java.lang.String identifier)
        Creates a new Chain with the given graph pdbIdentifier. This is not the single character chainIdentifier identifier, but the reference for the placement in the graph.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier in the graph.

      • Chain

        public Chain(Chain chain)

      • Chain

        public Chain()
        Creates a new Chain with the graph identifier 0. Use this method only if there is only one chainIdentifier and nothing more on this level in a structure.

    • Method Detail

      • connectChainBackbone

        public void connectChainBackbone()
        Connects the all residues, that are currently in the chainIdentifier, in order of their appearance in the List of AminoAcids (BranchSubstructure.getAminoAcids()).

      • connectPeptideBonds

        public void connectPeptideBonds(AminoAcid source,
                                AminoAcid target)
        Connects two residues, using the Backbone Carbon (C) of the source residue and the Backbone Nitrogen (N) of the target residue.
        Parameters:
        source - AminoAcid with Backbone Carbon.
        target - AminoAcid with Backbone Nitrogen.
